title: Desperate search for missing man 'kidnapped off street and forced into BMW'
text:

Police have launched a desperate search for a man who was allegedly abducted off the street and bundled into a BMW in broad daylight.

The incident happened just before 2.30pm on Sunday in Peckham, south-east London, the Met Police said.

A witness told detectives that they saw a man being forced into a black BMW car by three other men.

The car then drove off with the man inside, according to the witness.

Police have seized a BMW car - registration YE19 NDX - and arrested four men on suspicion of kidnap.

All four men remain in police custody for questioning as officers try to locate the alleged victim, the force said.

Have you been affected by the incident? Email webnews@mirror.co.uk.

A spokesperson said: "Police are appealing for information regarding an incident where a male was reportedly forced into a car in Peckham.

"The incident happened at around 14:25hrs on Sunday, 6 October in Kinsale Road, near to the junction of Dewar Street, SE15.

"A witness reported seeing a male being forced into a black BMW car by three other males.

"The car then drove off in the direction of Dewar Street before turning into Fenwick Road and Amott Road.

"Fast-time investigative work led to police recovering the vehicle, registration YE19 NDX, and four men, no further details, have been arrested on suspicion of kidnap.

"All four remain in custody at this time.

"Anyone with information that could assist this investigation is asked to contact Central South CID on 101 or tweet @MetCC and quote ref: 4379/6Oct. Alternatively, call Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111."
description: A witness told police they saw a man being forced into a black BMW car by three other men in Peckham, south-east London
